fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Exact match search should be the default in "Search Filters".
In Jira 8, the search result is changed from Jira 7.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1.Save the filter as "フィルターテスト1".
2.In "Search Filters(フィルターの検索)", search the filter with "フィルターテスト2".
3.The search result will be hit "フィルターテスト1".

 !jira-851-search-filter_フィルターテスト2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The filter "フィルターテスト1" will not be hit.
(This is same result as Jira 7)

- Jira 7
-- search with "フィルターテスト1"
 !jira-7121-search-filter_フィルターテスト1.png|thumbnail! 
-- search with "フィルターテスト2"
 !jira-7121-search-filter_フィルターテスト2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The filter "フィルターテスト1" will be hit.

- Jira 8
-- search with "フィルターテスト1"
 !jira-851-search-filter_フィルターテスト1.png|thumbnail! 
-- search with "フィルターテスト2"
 !jira-851-search-filter_フィルターテスト2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

You need to search with ""フィルターテスト2"".
 !jira-851-search-filter_フィルターテスト2-with-doublequotes.png|thumbnail! 

With double quotes(""), you can use exact match.
fields.summary: Exact match search should be the default in "Search Filters"

fields.description:
Currently ProForma User Fields in JSM do not behave the same as Jira User Fields. Specifically, customers cannot look up other customers even if they have the Browse Users permission. This is a documented deficiency in the ProForma documentation.

Now that ProForma is in-house, it would be great for Atlassian to resolve this and allow the ProForma User Field to behave the same as a Jira User Field.

[https://docs.thinktilt.com/proforma/ProForma-User-Lookup-Fields.1571291698.html]
fields.summary: Improve ProForma User Picker behavior on JSM portal pages

fields.description:
In 8.17.1 and later versions of Jira, the Version order when viewing the scrum backlog versions tab matches the order selected in on the Releases page, but the version order is inverted for the Fix Version dropdown menu.

The order matched in 8.5.1 but changed between then and 8.17.1.

Please allow for the display of these lists to be optionally displayed in as either inverted or the same, per customer preference, instead of only allowing them to be determined by the system.
fields.summary: Allow option for scrum backlog version order, Releases page, and Fix Version dropdown menu order to be a selectable option

fields.description:
Currently Jira will allow multiple tabs and multiple configurable fields to be placed within the Edit Issue screen but the space above the tabs is not configurable. 

Allowing this would streamline work to be able to have key fields in one location while also being able to change tabs and not lose sight of these key fields.
fields.summary: Allow Configurable Fields to be placed above tabs on Edit Issue screen

fields.description:
When viewing the Jira Upgrade page, we do not mention what to do with Jira Core ( if installed ) or how this is upgraded much as we do for Jira Software or Service Desk on the page.
 * [Upgrading Jira Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/upgrading-jira-server-976161476.html]

It would be valuable and prevent future Support cases if we listed out how this process works when Jira Core is also installed and the steps for customers to take for this and what to avoid doing.
fields.summary: Upgrade Jira Server page does not list our options for Jira Core when installed as well

SELECT id FROM fieldscreen WHERE name='Test Screen';

UPDATE fieldscreen SET description=NULL WHERE id=10029;

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira is affected by Tomcat CVE-2021-42340 - Denial of service via an OutOfMemoryError (Base Score: 7.5 HIGH)
bq. The fix for bug 63362 introduced a memory leak. The object introduced to collect metrics for HTTP upgrade connections was not released for WebSocket connections once the WebSocket connection was closed. This created a memory leak that, over time, could lead to a denial of service via an OutOfMemoryError. 

The recently disclosed vulnerability regarding Tomcat [CVE-2021-42340|https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-42340] affects the following versions:
 * Apache Tomcat 8.5.60 to 8.5.71
 * Apache Tomcat 9.0.40 to 9.0.53
 * Apache Tomcat 10.0.0-M10 to 10.0.11

Mitigation:
 Users of the affected versions should apply one of the following mitigations:
 * Upgrade to Apache Tomcat 8.5.72 or later
 * Upgrade to Apache Tomcat 9.0.54 or later
 * Upgrade to Apache Tomcat 10.0.12 or later
 * Upgrade to Apache Tomcat 10.1.0-M6 or later

h3. Steps to Reproduce

See more at: [https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-42340] and [https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2021-42340]
h3. Expected Results
 * Not applicable.

h3. Actual Results
 * Not applicable.


*Affected Jira versions:*
8.15 to 8.19

h3. Workaround
 * You can manually upgrade the Apache Tomcat version used by Jira following the procedures outlined in the following article: [How to Upgrade Apache Tomcat version in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-upgrade-apache-tomcat-version-in-jira-7-x-879957866.html].
fields.summary: Jira is affected by Tomcat CVE-2021-42340 - Denial of service via an OutOfMemoryError

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

TimSort throws "Comparison method violates its general contract!" error. 

This is similar to the reported Confluence bug# CONFSERVER-58059

In my specific case, it was being thrown when trying to create a new Application link in Jira. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

When trying to create an application link Cog -> Applications -> Application Links. From here trying to create an application link IE [https://example-test.com|https://example-test.com/] This pops open the configure application URL to confirm the URL. The configuration just needs the Application Name and the checkbox for Create Incoming Link checked. This results in the "Comparison method violates its general contract!" error in the UI.

 
h3. Expected Results

No exception raised and continues with the requested operation.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: Comparison method violates its general contract!
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Comparison method violates its general contract!
	at java.util.TimSort.mergeLo(TimSort.java:777)
	at java.util.TimSort.mergeAt(TimSort.java:514)
	at java.util.TimSort.mergeCollapse(TimSort.java:441)
	at java.util.TimSort.sort(TimSort.java:245)
	at java.util.Arrays.sort(Arrays.java:1512)
	at java.util.ArrayList.sort(ArrayList.java:1464)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Adding this JVM system property fixes the issue:
{code:java}
-Djava.util.Arrays.useLegacyMergeSort=true{code}
fields.summary: TimSort throws "Comparison method violates its general contract!" error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When cached data is updated by UPM, it updates the database and invalidates the *CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore* cache. This invalidated all entries with ‘entityName =jira.properties, entityId = 1’ keys, all the requests trying to access any data from jira.properties, tries to load the cache or get blocked by the others.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Generate high load
 # Navigate to *Administration > Manage apps > Find new apps* to trigger a request to */rest/plugins/1.0/notifications* to invalidate the cache or install/uninstall/update an app

h3. Expected Results

Jira performing without any performance issue
h3. Actual Results

Threads are blocked by the threads running to load the cache.
 !IBM_Thread_and_Monitor_Dump_Analyzer_for_Java-7.png|thumbnail! 
 !tdump-2.png|thumbnail! 

Additional logs enabled via ByteCat shows the notification requests from UPM causing cache invalidation on *entityName = jira.properties, entityId = 1*
{noformat}
2021-10-07 04:56:25,484+0200 https-jsse-nio-8443-exec-1 url: /rest/plugins/1.0/notifications; user: username WARN username 123x45678x9 abcdef 192.168.1.1 /rest/plugins/1.0/notifications [Logging] CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.invalidateCacheEntry entityName = jira.properties, entityId = 1
2021-10-07 04:56:25,521+0200 https-jsse-nio-8443-exec-1 url: /rest/plugins/1.0/notifications; user: username WARN username 123x45678x9 abcdef 192.168.1.1 /rest/plugins/1.0/notifications [Logging] CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.loadPropertySetData onCacheMiss entityName = jira.properties, entityId = 1
2021-10-07 04:56:26,727+0200 https-jsse-nio-8443-exec-1 url: /rest/plugins/1.0/notifications; user: username WARN username 123x45678x9 abcdef 192.168.1.1 /rest/plugins/1.0/notifications [Logging] CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.invalidateCacheEntry entityName = jira.properties, entityId = 1
2021-10-07 04:56:26,753+0200 https-jsse-nio-8443-exec-1 url: /rest/plugins/1.0/notifications; user: username WARN username 123x45678x9 abcdef 192.168.1.1 /rest/plugins/1.0/notifications [Logging] CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.loadPropertySetData onCacheMiss entityName = jira.properties, entityId = 1
2021-10-07 04:56:27,840+0200 https-jsse-nio-8443-exec-1 url: /rest/plugins/1.0/notifications; user: username WARN username 123x45678x9 abcdef 192.168.1.1 /rest/plugins/1.0/notifications [Logging] CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.invalidateCacheEntry entityName = jira.properties, entityId = 1
2021-10-07 04:56:27,867+0200 https-jsse-nio-8443-exec-1 url: /rest/plugins/1.0/notifications; user: username WARN username 123x45678x9 abcdef 192.168.1.1 /rest/plugins/1.0/notifications [Logging] CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.loadPropertySetData onCacheMiss entityName = jira.properties, entityId = 1
2021-10-07 04:56:28,980+0200 https-jsse-nio-8443-exec-1 url: /rest/plugins/1.0/notifications; user: username WARN username 123x45678x9 abcdef 192.168.1.1 /rest/plugins/1.0/notifications [Logging] CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.invalidateCacheEntry entityName = jira.properties, entityId = 1
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In Jira 8.6, we have added REST API endpoint to allow workflow scheme creation but there's no REST API endpoint to create workflow itself. This makes is difficult for users who would like to fully automate project related configuration.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add REST API endpoint to allow users to create workflow through REST API. 

h3. Workaround 

None. Users will have to create workflow in Jira from UI.
fields.summary: Add REST API Endpoint to allow workflow creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Customer has noticed the below behaviour and would like to change this.
When we Click through >> Releases >> Click on one Version >> Click on any issue and then click back button, the page is not redirected to the exact previous page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Releases > screenshot-1
# Click on any Version > screenshot-2
# Click on any sub section > screenshot-3
# Click on one issue > screenshot-4
# Click on the back button in the browser > screenshot-5


h3. Expected Results
The page should go to Issue listing

h3. Actual Results
The page redirects to the Versions first page > screenshot-6

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
Actually it is only possible to give the right to use import/export to admins users or all users.

In the case of an organisation of project with groups of users, for example "project admin", "project reader", "project developper"...

It is not possible to restrict the usage of import/export to only "project admin". We can only give the right to all users or restrict this usage by adding admin rights to somes users.

The second point give them the possibility to access and modify Jira configuration and to see all existing projects.
fields.summary: Possibility to give the right for import/export to a group

fields.description: For Jira implementation with a large number of projects, it would be ideal if custom fields could have an attribute at the context or field configuration scheme level where the name of the field as it appears on a screen can be modified. Ideally, this would allow fields to be reused for multiple purposes in larger implementations without having the adverse performance impact of creating new custom fields for each instance where you need a new field name.

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center allow authenticated but non-admin remote attackers to edit email batch configurations via an Improper Authorization vulnerability in the /secure/admin/ConfigureBatching!default.jspa endpoint.

The affected versions are before version 8.21.0.

*Affected versions:*

 * version < 8.21.0

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using Jira's [database integrity checker|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/using-the-database-integrity-checker-938847667.html] to fix workflow issues, there are situations where it fails to locate entries at the os_wfentry table which are associated with incorrect workflows. This integrity problem causes Jira to fail to display transitions at the affected Jira issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Under normal circumstances, this can happen if a workflow migration fails to update the "name" column at the os_wfentry. With that said, for testing purposes, this behavior can be simulated with the following steps:
# Create a new Jira issue
# Update the os_wfentry table for that issue to point it to a workflow that is not associated with that issue type: {code:sql}update os_wfentry set name = 'classic default workflow' where id = 10000;{code}
# Run Jira's [workflow integrity checks|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/using-the-database-integrity-checker-938847667.html] to detect inconsistencies at workflow entries

h3. Expected Results
The affected entry will be detected and fixed by Jira's [database integrity checker|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/using-the-database-integrity-checker-938847667.html].

h3. Actual Results
No inconsistencies are found in the database.

h3. Workaround
# [Copy the affected workflow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/working-with-workflows-938847362.html#Workingwithworkflows-Copyanexistingworkflow]
# [Associate the copied workflow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-workflow-schemes-938847421.html#Configuringworkflowschemes-workflowsConfiguringworkflowsforaworkflowscheme] with the issue types that were associated with the affected workflow
(i) You may associate the affected issue types back to the original workflow after that.
fields.summary: Jira's workflow integrity checks can fail to fix invalid workflow associations

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2021-09-01 17:33:40,335-0400 ProjectImport: CreateIssues:thread-10 ERROR josealbb 1053x34839x1 o3wiiv xx.xx.xx.xx,xx.xx.xx.xx /secure/admin/ProjectImportSummary.jspa [c.a.j.imports.project.DefaultProjectImportPersister] Unable to create issue with key 'TEST-123'.

	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:124)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:185)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:212)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy3137.searchCountOverrideSecurity(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.webhooks.matcher.JqlEventMatcher.matchJql(JqlEventMatcher.java:58)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.webhooks.workflow.TriggerWebhookFunction.execute(TriggerWebhookFunction.java:60)

	at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.transitionWorkflow(AbstractWorkflow.java:1407)
	at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.initialize(AbstractWorkflow.java:606)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.createIssue(OSWorkflowManager.java:754)

{noformat}

This happens is because some changes have been made to Jira version 8.x that requrie a context to be created for the JQL search enginee to work properly.  A new version of Lucene has been introduced, which is used to process JQL queries.

Asynchronous event processing in the Webhook plugin was implemented differently and it has something to do with the matchJql/searchCountOverrideSecurity function. This has already been fixed in version 8.19.1.


h3. Workaround

* Backup the workflow in your souce Jira instance by creating a copy. 
* Remove the Webhook post function in the issue creation transition in the workflow. 
* Create the same workflow in the target instance without any webhook post function in the issue creation transition. 
* Import the project to the target instance. 
* Move the project to a workflow contains the webhook post function in your target instance.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the publishing of an automation rule fails due to permissions, it will throw which permission is missing as in the message below (where the action refers to adding comments): *Either you or the rule actor for this rule is missing some required permissions: ADD_COMMENTS*

But that will not say which project is responsible, for global project rules this may be cumbersome to troubleshoot. 

And there is a specific scenario that can be even more troubling, projects that are archived will still be tied to active permission schemes, but archived projects will also throw the permission errors to publish the rule.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a global automation rule to edit a field and include 2 active projects in it
 # Archive one of the projects
 # Edit anything on the rule, such as the description and try to publish

h3. Suggestion
Specify which project is responsible for the failure to publish the automation rule and consider pointing out archived projects
fields.summary: Improve error messages for permission errors to publish automation rules

fields.description:
*The Problem*

There is no limit on the number of subtasks that can be created against a single Jira issue. When a large number of subtasks are created on an issue (e.g. in the hundreds), Jira can experience problems with loading the issue screen for that issue. The page will often take several seconds to load, or simply crash.

 

*Proposed Solution*

A new advanced setting to be made available to Jira System Administrators, to set the maximum number of subtasks to be created on a single issue. This could be switched off by default.

On an issue where the subtask limit has been reached, a user attempting to submit the "create sub-task" form would be presented with an error such as "The maximum number of subtasks allowed on this issue has been reached."
fields.summary: New Advanced Setting: Limit the Number of Subtasks on an Issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Jira Chart Macro fails to be displayed in Confluence pages, when using Jira Data Center on at least 2 nodes.
h3. Environment

Confluence Server on any 7.x version.
Jira Data Center on 8.16.1 or any version above, and using at least 2 nodes. 

(!) Also replicable in the Jira 8.20.0 EAP Version downloadable [here|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download-eap]


h3. Steps to replicate

These steps have been written while using Confluence Server 7.2.0 and Jira DC 8.18.2 with 2 nodes:
 - Install a Confluence Server instance
 - Install a Jira Data Center instance using 2 nodes
 - Create an application link between Confluence and Jira
 - In Confluence:
 -- create a new page
 -- add to this page a *Jira Charts* macro by going to *Insert more content > Other Macros > Development > Jira Charts*
 -- save the page

h3. Expected results

The Jira Charts macro is showing in the Confluence page at all times:
 !Bug_ExpectedResult_ConfluencePage.png|thumbnail!

The sub-folder */caches/charts* exists in the shared home folder, and contains files with name using the format jfreechart-onetime-XXXXXXXXX.png
 !Bug_ExpectedResult_SharedHome.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual results

The Jira Charts macro is not showing in the Confluence page. Instead, the following error is displayed in the UI:
{code:java}
com.atlassian.sal.api.net.ResponseException: Can not retrieve jira chart image
{code}
!Bug_ObservedResult_ConfluencePage_MostofTime.png|thumbnail!

In the Jira application logs, the following warnings are thrown:
{code:java}
2021-10-07 12:08:11,705+0200 http-nio-1132-exec-12 WARN anonymous 728x403x1 - 127.0.0.1,127.0.0.1 /charts [c.a.j.charts.jfreechart.DisplayChartServlet] File not found, returning 404 (filename='jfreechart-onetime-5406716692030141860.png').
2021-10-07 12:08:11,707+0200 http-nio-1132-exec-12 WARN   -   [c.a.j.w.action.util.Error404] Detected anonymous access to page <JIRABASE_URL/charts> redirecting to login page
{code}
When checking the node local home folder and shared home folder, the following can be observed:
 - files with name using the format jfreechart-onetime-XXXXXXXXX.png keep being added to each local node local home folder in the sub folder */caches/charts*:
 !Bug_ObservedResult_Node1_folder.png|thumbnail! 
 !Bug_ObservedResult_Node2_folder.png|thumbnail!
 - the sub-folder */caches/charts* does not exist in the shared home folder
 !Bug_ObservedResult_SharedHome.png|thumbnail!

This is actually what is causing the bug: normally, the files jfreechart-onetime-XXXXXXXXX.png should be created in *<Jira_shared_home>/caches/charts* instead of the node local home folders. However, due to the bug, these files are created instead in the node local home folders.

h3. Notes

h4. Note 1

When refreshing the Confluence page a high number of times, the Jira Charts macro might rarely show:
 !Bug_ObservedResult_ConfluencePage_FromTimeToTime.png|thumbnail!

h4. Note 2

The error "com.atlassian.sal.api.net.ResponseException: Can not retrieve jira chart image" might also be seen in the pop-up window, when trying to insert the Jira Chart (and by either selecting the "Pie Chart" or the "Created vs Resolved" option:
 !Error_InsertJiraChart_PieChart.png|thumbnail! 
 !Error_InsertJiraChart_CreatevsResolved.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

(!) Note that the workaround below can only be used when Jira is installed on a Linux environment

The workaround consists in creating a symlink pointing from the */caches/charts* folder of each node to the shared home counterpart. Make sure you have a backup of your instance and files.
 * Bring one node down
 * Remove *<Jira Local Home>/caches/charts* (replace Jira Local Home with the actual path of the node home folder)
 ** {{cd <Jira Local Home>/caches}}
 ** {{rmdir charts}}
 * Create a symbolic link to *<Jira Shared Home>/caches/charts* directory (replace Jira Local Home with the actual path of the node home folder)
 ** {{cd <Jira Local Home>/caches}}
 ** {{ln -s <Jira Shared Home>/caches/charts charts}}
 * Restart the node.
 * Repeat on the other nodes, one by one.
fields.summary: The Jira Chart Macro fails to be displayed in Confluence pages when using Jira Data Center on at least 2 nodes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Since the release of JRASERVER-72339 , Jira 8.19.X ships with OpenJDK 11 however the bundled AdoptOpen JDK 11.0.11 is affected by CVE-2021-2388 :

* https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-2388 - CVSS 3.1 Base Score 7.5
* Quote from doc
bq. This vulnerability does not apply to Java deployments, typically in servers, that load and run only trusted code (e.g., code installed by an administrator). 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use the bin installer to Install Jira 8.19.X
# Check the JAVA version 

h3. Expected Results
Bundled JAVA version should not be affected by CVE-2021-2388

h3. Actual Results
Bundled JAVA version is affected by CVE-2021-2388

h3. Workaround

If you are using the embedded JAVA, change the JAVA version following the steps here:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/change-the-java-version-used-by-jira-server-765594330.html

Upgrade Java to the latest stable version of JDK ( 11.0.12+7 )
* https://adoptium.net/?variant=openjdk11
* https://www.oracle.com/java/technologies/javase/11all-relnotes.html
fields.summary: Jira 8.19.X ships with JDK 11.0.11 which is affected by CVE-2021-2388

When the Assignee is changed from one user to another and both have a common name (first, middle or last), the notification email does not display the changes correctly.

 # Create two users with the middle name of first user being the same as the last name of the second user (eg. user1 named _First1 Abc Last1_ and user2 named _First2 Abc_)
 # Create an issue and assign it to user1, then re-assign it to user2

!image-2021-10-06-19-16-13-118.png|width=509,height=159!
h3. Expected Results

The notification email contains the full name of both old and new assignee (eg: Assignee: _-First1 Abc Last1- First2 Abc_)

!image-2021-10-06-19-15-36-302.png|width=387,height=291!

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to make an '@' mention, or select an assignee on your issues, you may not get the proper results when searching for the last name.
(i) Other user-picker custom or system fields should not be affected.

This problem is originated due to a performance improvement change made to how user searches work in Jira starting on version 8.19.1.

In the past, Jira would try to match the search prefix with every word of the display name (eg. "John" & "Doe"), however, now we match the prefix (using {{startsWith}}) only with the whole display name ("John Doe"). While the search is also applied to the 'first_name' and 'last_name' data, in case the 'last_name' information doesn't match the same format as the display name (eg. using a different set of characters such as "Джон" & "Доу", which translates to "John Doe"), Jira won't be able to find results.

  
*Note:*  While this report is very similar to JSWSERVER-21109 (which affects 'third' name searches), the causes for each are different. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new user in Jira with the following fields.
 (i) The Jira UI will display the user name with the standard western character set, however on the backend, the individual names will be set using a different set.
 ** *first_name* = 'Джон'
 ** *lower_first_name* = 'джон'
 ** *last_name* = 'Доу'
 ** *lower_last_name* = 'доу'
 ** *display_name*='John Doe'
 ** *lower_display_name* = 'john doe'
 # Try to create an '@' mention, or select an assignee searching for its last name - 'Doe'.
 ** If you initially search for 'John' on user mentions, you may get temporary results due to Jira loading the values on its front-end cache, however, this will be invalidated when refreshing the page.

h3. Expected Results

Since 'Doe' is set on the display name, we should get results when searching for it.
h3. Actual Results

Since 'Doe' is not the first name of the display name, and the individual last_name is set as 'Доу', no results will be returned.
h3. Workaround
 * Search using the user's first name.
 * In case the user originates from an external LDAP connection, adjust the LDAP parameters to fetch the first and last names in the same format (character set) as the display name.
fields.summary: Assignee and @mention user searches using the last name don't work when the 'last_name' format doesn't match the 'display name'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Email notifications for @mention show username instead of full name. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a user with the following format:
#* Username: user
#* Full name: I Am A User
#* Email: user@example-instance.com
# Create a new issue 
# @mention 'user' in the comment
# View the email 
# @mention 'user' in another comment
# Flush Mail Queue and observe the email


h3. Expected Results
Full name is displayed in the email.

h3. Actual Results
Username is displayed in the email. 

!8_19_1-Flush_vs_Unflushed.png|thumbnail!

 h3. Note
(!) This behavior does not happen when:
* 'Batching email notifications' is enabled
* Emails are flushed from the Mail Queue

h3. Workaround
Enable 'Batching email notifications' and set the interval to 2 minutes to minimize change.
fields.summary: @mention email notifications show username instead of full name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a menu from the blue menu is large enough, the blue header area disappear. It would not actually be possible to scroll up to show the top part of the page after replicating the issue unless the page is being refreshed.

Browsers:
 * The problem is present on:
 ** Chrome:
 *** {{Version 94.0.4606.61}}
 *** {{Version 93.0.4577.82}}
 *** {{Version 94.0.4606.71}}
 *** {{Version 94.0.4606.81}}
 ** Edge (chromium):
 *** Version 94.0.992.47
 ** Safari:
 *** Version 15.0 (16612.1.29.41.4, 16612)
 * The problem is *not* present on:
 ** Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a lot of dashboards.
 # Open an issue in issue view and select "Dashboards" from the header.
 # Click the "Dashboards" menu in header area when viewing any issue

*N.B.* The problem also occurs when there is a large quantity of other menu items in the header such as "Issues" and "Filters".
h3. Expected Results

Header is visible, Add comment button is in view, No missing/scrolled out blue header on top.
h3. Actual Results

The blue header area is not present (see the attachment)

It is not possible to scroll up to show the top part of the page after replicating the issue unless the page is being refreshed or resized to a larger vertical size.
h3. Workaround

Reload the page.

*Notes*: Replicated on Chrome and Safari. Firefox works fine.
fields.summary: Blue Header Area disappears

fields.description:

In the Document [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/managing-system-fields-1047552725.html] there is a link under the section of Identifying you fields:
{quote}See list of [all available system fields|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jatestlanding/issue-fields-and-statuses-990548900.html]

 # In an incognito browsing session, click that link of https://confluence.atlassian.com/jatestlanding/issue-fields-and-statuses-990548900.html

h3. Expected Results

Page should load to show documentation
h3. Actual Results
403 - Forbidden page is displayed

h3. Workaround
None

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is not possible to add a project role to a user that currently has no project roles  from the User Management page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user with no project roles 
# Go to the User management page
# Under actions, click the 3 dots for this user and then click "View Project Roles"
# Click "Edit Project Roles" button from the top right  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

There should be project role options visible for the user to get added :

!image-2021-10-04-17-11-11-362.png|thumbnail!
  
h3. Actual Results

There is no option to add the user to project roles  

!image-2021-10-04-17-26-05-963.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Add the user to at least one project role via project settings. Now the project roles are visible from the User Management page. 

!image-2021-10-04-17-11-55-605.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, the Archived filter export allows only for the default filters to be exported, or all of them.

h3. Expectation

I'd be great to have additional column options, such as the one seen below, so that customers can choose which fields are displayed on the export:

!column.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add field column selection when exporting archived issues

fields.description:
Hey Team,

We could see that there is limitation of only 20 groups visibility in group picker under global permissions page when assigning (granting) permissions to groups.

When we have 100's of groups involved, we can only see 20 groups which makes it really difficult if we don't remember group names. Also this information is not alphabetically sorted or not sure on what basis the groups appear (may be on last accessed basis).

We need a feature to see all available groups when we need to choose the groups. If not all groups can be loaded at same time owing to performance issues, we should atleast have pagination approach to decide and select the user groups.

Thanks and Regards.
fields.summary: Limitation of only 20 groups visibility in group picker option under global permissions page when assigning (granting) permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Add user or group to the role in the project won't function for hashtag roles (eg. #Software DE employee)
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Below are the steps to reproduce the first issue*
 # Create more than 30 groups(Active Directory) with <hashtag>.
 # Example *#Software Group*, *#Product management*.
 # Navigate to any ⚙️ Project Settings > Users and roles > Add users to a role.
 # Search for groups with #<Group Name> and the search doesn’t provide expected results. Example: *#Product Development DE Assistant*
 !Screenshot-3-1.png|thumbnail!

*Below are the steps to reproduce the second issue*.
 - Navigate to any _*⚙️ Project Settings > Users and roles > Add users to a role*_.
 - Add group and Role.
 - Now, cancel the group selected and the page will be blank
 [^Video-1.mov] 
 !Screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The search result should provide the exact group name at the top while searching.
h3. Actual Results

The search result doesn’t provide the exact group name.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Add user or group to role in project won't function for hashtag roles

fields.description:
When creating a Jira Report in Confluence containing the field 'Linked issues', the *Key* of the Linked issues are displayed only.

It would be extremely useful for the Jira Report to display both the *Key* and the *Description* of the Linked issues, similar to how they appear on the Issue screen.

The *Key* in itself is of little value without the *Description.*
fields.summary: Display Description of 'linked issues' in Jira Reports

fields.description:

Some of the groups have been synced with LDAP and we don't know which ones we created VS which ones were synced.

h4. Workaround
In the Jira Audit Log it is possible to filter by Groups Created using  the filter by _Category_ as '*group management'* and _Summary_ as '*group created'*,
fields.summary: Filter Groups created internally on Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a transition has the edit issue screen and this transition comes from a non-editable status (An status with this property: jira.issue.editable = false) to a non-editable status, you can edit any field except the Epic link field.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project.
 # On this project, create an Epic and another issue (E.g. {color:#0747a6}issue A{color}) that is linked with the Epic.
 # On the project workflow, set the _jira.issue.editable = false_ property for a status (E.g 'Done' status)
 # Create a transition ({color:#de350b}transition X{color}) from this status to himself ('{color:#00875a}Done{color}' -> '{color:#00875a}Done{color}').
 # For this transition set the issue edit screen.
 # On the project, transition the {color:#0747a6}issue A{color} to the '{color:#00875a}Done' status.{color}
 # On the {color:#0747a6}issue A{color}, perform the {color:#de350b}transition X{color} and try to edit all fields.

h3. Expected Results

All fields should be editable.
h3. Actual Results

You can't edit the Epic link field

The screencast below shows the mentioned behavior:

[^replicated beahvior.mp4]
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Can't edit epic link through screen transition between two non-editable statuses

fields.description:

When in Agile board view when clkick to add comment and paste the attachment or even if select the attachment in text mode then attachment get saved fine but the comment added does not get saved
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to any agile board
 # click on the issue to open issue in agile view on right hand side, go to text mode, add comment and paste attachment

comment should get saved with attachment

Only attachment is getting saved

Add comment and attachment from issue navigator view/normal edit view

fields.description:

REST API search (rest/api/2/user/picker?query="ab@domain.com") for users using email address is returning inaccurate results

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create multiple users with email addresses like abc@domain.com, abcd@domain.com
 # Now, using REST APIC query for users having email address ab@domain.com
# example: rest/api/2/user/picker?query="ab@domain.com"


h3. Expected Results

# This should return no users 

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
When performing a bulk action to edit the selected issues, the only available option is to "change" the current users on that field for new ones.

In this case, the custom field type "Multi user" cannot "add" users in the bulk edit option.

The suggestion is to add a possibility to retain the users already stored for each issue while adding more users to the field.
fields.summary: Add ability to add users while performing a bulk edit, instead of "change" users in the fields.

fields.description:
This screen: /secure/admin/AssociateIssueTypeSchemes!default.jspa?fieldId=&schemeId=
This screen is driven by a multi-select dropdown that is:
 * Not resizable
 * Forces you to hold-down the CTRL while adding new projects

Would be better to allow us to search and add to a list of projects instead. I've wasted at least 8 hours redoing this because someone didn't know how it worked (administrator) and deselected 500+ teams in a scheme. !image-2021-09-30-13-30-51-028.png!
fields.summary: Issue Type Scheme, associate screen, needs help

fields.description:
There are several, centrally added add-ons (apps) that do not have the ability for us to turn-off on a per-project basis. This implies a lack of a developer standard for those add-ons.
 * Allow an opt-in at a project level
 * Allow and opt-out at a user level (personalization, simplification of UI)
fields.summary: Force consistency on add-ons, ensure we can turn them off at the project level

fields.description:
With our integration into Jira Align, we find that our users get confused with the differences in terminology. Issue:Epic = Features in Align, or Issue:Bug = Defect in Align.

A good solution would be:
 * Configured with a Screen Scheme
 * Allow for "Display Name" of the used Issue Types to be typed in, allowing us to integrate with the out of the box issue-types and yet, keep synchronized on terminology between multiple systems.
fields.summary: Provide "alias" or "screen display" for Issues

fields.description:
We've noted some large buckets with the Jira Permission Scheme, that does not allow us to implement automation and our standard work within our 500+ projects consistently.

Propose:
 * *Administer Projects*
 ** Break out into separate items, we have automated membership assignment, and without removing teams from managing the other three items, we have to rely on email to enforce our security approach.
 *** "Manage Project Versions" <-- we want teams to manage
 *** "Manage Project Components" <-- we want teams to manage
 *** "Manage Role Memberships"  <-- we automate
 *** "Manage Project Details" <-- we want teams to manage
 * Manage Sprints
 ** Break out specific items allowing for automation (create, start, complete), while still lettings teams manage adding Sprint Goals (bundled in this)
 *** "Manage Sprint Create, Delete" <-- we automate
 *** "Manage Sprint Start, Complete, Reopening"  <-- we automate
 *** "Manage Sprint Information" <-- we automate
 *** "Manage Sprint Goals" <-- we want teams to manage
fields.summary: Expand Permissions Scheme to avoid giving too much access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

At times the replication queue files can become quite large, resulting in errors with cache replication. This has happened across a number of tickets and root cause is still not known. A common theme is the size of localq files.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

n/a
h3. Expected Results

Cache replication continues to work without errors
h3. Actual Results

Cache replication fails with these errors in logs:
{code:java}
2021-09-20 19:03:01,157 http-nio-8080-exec-84 ERROR Jira 1303x259x4 11g2toz 10.12.200.110,10.12.200.110,127.0.0.1 /rest/api/2/issue/TEST-13214/remotelink [c.a.j.c.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheManager] [LOCALQ] Critical state of local cache replication queue - cannot add: LocalQCacheOp{cacheName='com.atlassian.jira.cluster.dbr.DBRMessage', action=PUT, key=DBR, value == null ? false, replicatePutsViaCopy=true, creationTimeInMillis=1632164581156} to queue: [queueId=queue_prodnode2_1_9c79a1ab55dcc55cc4a830cfc917b8a9_put, queuePath=/var/atlassian/jira/application-data/localq/queue_prodnode2_1_9c79a1ab55dcc55cc4a830cfc917b8a9_put], error: Failed to add entry.
com.squareup.tape.FileException: Failed to add entry.
	at com.squareup.tape.FileObjectQueue.add(FileObjectQueue.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.tape.TapeLocalQCacheOpQueue.add(TapeLocalQCacheOpQueue.java:167)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheOpQueueWithStats.add(LocalQCacheOpQueueWithStats.java:121)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheManager.addToQueue(LocalQCacheManager.java:401)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheManager.addToAllQueues(LocalQCacheManager.java:382)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheReplicator.replicateToQueue(LocalQCacheReplicator.java:87)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheReplicator.replicatePutNotification(LocalQCacheReplicator.java:67)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.cache.ehcache.AbstractJiraCacheReplicator.notifyElementUpdated(AbstractJiraCacheReplicator.java:123)
	at net.sf.ehcache.event.RegisteredEventListeners.internalNotifyElementUpdated(RegisteredEventListeners.java:228)
	at net.sf.ehcache.event.RegisteredEventListeners.notifyElementUpdated(RegisteredEventListeners.java:206)
	at net.sf.ehcache.Cache.notifyPutInternalListeners(Cache.java:1646)
	at net.sf.ehcache.Cache.putInternal(Cache.java:1618)
	at net.sf.ehcache.Cache.put(Cache.java:1543)
	at net.sf.ehcache.Cache.put(Cache.java:1508)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCache.put(DelegatingCache.java:93)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cache.DeferredReplicationCache.lambda$put$0(DeferredReplicationCache.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.cache.ehcache.BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.runDeferred(BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.java:172)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cache.DeferredReplicationCache.put(DeferredReplicationCache.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.dbr.transport.DefaultDBRTransportManager.send(DefaultDBRTransportManager.java:45)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.dbr.DefaultDBRSender.sendDBRMessage(DefaultDBRSender.java:135)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.dbr.DefaultDBRSender.sendUpdateWithRelated(DefaultDBRSender.java:90)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.dbr.AsyncDBRSender.lambda$sendUpdateWithRelated$0(AsyncDBRSender.java:68)
	at co.elastic.apm.agent.concurrent.JavaConcurrent$RunnableLambdaWrapper.run(JavaConcurrent.java:220)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:515)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:264)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1128)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:628)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:834)
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Invalid argument
	at java.base/java.io.RandomAccessFile.setLength(Native Method)
	at com.squareup.tape.QueueFile.setLength(QueueFile.java:406)
	at com.squareup.tape.QueueFile.expandIfNecessary(QueueFile.java:375)
	at com.squareup.tape.QueueFile.add(QueueFile.java:305)
	at com.squareup.tape.FileObjectQueue.add(FileObjectQueue.java:58)
{code}
h3. Workaround

In several reports, deleting the contents the localq directory on each node and restarting Jira seems to resolve the errors.

The localq files are found in the following path:
 * <local-home-directory>/localq

Each file will be named similarly to the ones below:
{noformat}
queue_Node2_0_f5f366263dcc357e2720042f33286f8f
queue_Node2_9_f5f366263dcc357e2720042f33286f8f
queue_Node3_0_bbb747b1516b5225f1ec1c65887b39fc
queue_Node3_9_bbb747b1516b5225f1ec1c65887b39fc  {noformat}
h3. Investigation

In general localq queue files should be most of the time empty. When they are overflowing there is already another problem in the system. Please use the localq stats to investigate what process is the main source of cache replication events.

1. In the error message find which type of queues are overflowing: via copy or via invalidation:
via copy: *replicatePutsViaCopy=true*
{code:java}
...LocalQCacheOp{cacheName='com.atlassian.jira.cluster.dbr.DBRMessage', action=PUT, key=DBR, value == null ? false, replicatePutsViaCopy=true,...
{code}
via invalidation: *replicatePutsViaCopy=false*

2. Now search in the log for the last entry for total localq stats:
via copy
{code:java}
cat atlassian-jira.log | grep JIRA-STATS | grep LOCALQ | grep VIA-COPY{code}
via invalidation
{code:java}
cat atlassian-jira.log | grep JIRA-STATS | grep LOCALQ | grep VIA-INVALIDATION{code}
3. Get the json part of the last log line:
{code:java}
[LOCALQ] [VIA-INVALIDATION] Cache replication queue stats per node: node2 total stats: 
 {
  "timestampMillis": 1610720566437,
  "nodeId": "node2",
  "queueSize": 0,
  "startQueueSize": 0,
  ...{code}
4. Look at the last section in the above json log:
{code:java}
"addCounterByCacheTopN": {
    "UserPropertyManager.ApplicationUser.cache": 543,
    "com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.LazyOfBizUserCache.userCache": 291,
    "com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.queue.ProjectStateCacheManagerImpl.sdProjectStateCache": 
    "com.atlassian.gadgets.renderer.internal.cache.messageBundles": 153,
    "com.atlassian.gadgets.renderer.internal.cache.httpResponses": 94,
    "DbBackedCachedPropertySetManager.jira.properties.cache": 66,
    "com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizInternalMembershipDao.childrenCache": 37,
    "com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizInternalMembershipDao.parentsCache": 37,
    "com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizDirectoryDao.directoryCache": 10,
    "com.atlassian.jira.workflow.CachingDraftWorkflowStore.draftWorkflowCache": 8
  }
{code}
This entry shows topN threads contributing to the replication queue: [thread name]:[number of added entries]
 This may give you some hint on what is causing the problem.
fields.summary: Large Localq filesizes can result in Cache Replication errors from Tape

fields.description:
Currently, the fix for this behavior involves shutting down Jira and manually fixing the database.  

See this link:
 * [IndexingFailureException thrown during reindex of Jira server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/indexingfailureexception-thrown-during-reindex-of-jira-server-779158905.html]

We know that ranking can be paused during a Lexorank rebalance operation, and the query for the resolution above is a dynamic query that only needs to know the rank field ID, so we'd like to see a way to fix this in the UI while Jira is up and running.
fields.summary: Improve fix for "Expected exactly one rank row for issue[id=###] for rank field[id=###], but found 2 rows" Lexorank error

fields.description:
h3. Issue

As per [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59101?focusedCommentId=2406855&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-2406855], after the bug JRASERVER-59101 got fixed, only some values are accepted by Jira for the *Access-Control-Allow-Headers* header in preflight requests:
{quote}
pre-flight OPTIONS request can only contain the following values in its Access-Control-Request-Headers: X-Atlassian-Token, Authorization and Content-Type. Adding any more values will make your CORS request rejected.
{quote}

Because of that, if a preflight request uses the *cookies* value, the request will be rejected.

Some customers prefer to use the *cookies* method for authentication rather than the accepted ones (X-Atlassian-Token, Authorization and Content-Type)

h3. Suggestion

h4. Suggestion 1

Make the *cookies* header allowed by Jira in Preflight requests.

h4. Suggestion 2

Make the allowed headers configurable that customers can set to what they prefer, based on their use case.
fields.summary: Make Jira allow the cookies value for the Access-Control-Allow-Headers in Preflight requests

fields.description:
Switching the Priority scheme is currently only possible via global configuration, by selecting projects using Ctrl+click or Command+click in a multi-select field with hundreds or thousands of projects.

This is prone to errors, as there are no warning or confirmation steps to see which projects are being (un)assigned from the scheme.

One clicking without holding Ctrl / Command can mean unassigning dozens of projects from a scheme inadvertently, 

Please enable switching  Priority schemes from within individual project settings, by adding the "Switch scheme" button to 

This will make it aligned with how Workflow and other schemes can be switched in the context of a particular project.

Thank you,
Daniel
fields.summary: Enable switching Priority schemes from within individual project settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As of Jira 8.19, the Screens administration page uses the REST API to paginate and load the list of screens according to [JRASERVER-67331: View Screens page load slow when there are many screens and workflows|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67331].
When there is a workflow imported that contains a screen that doesn't exist, loading the Screen Administration page {{<baseurl>/secure/admin/ViewFieldScreens.jspa}} ends up with an HTTP 500 error.
The corresponding log entry mentions a missing screen {{java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot find Screen with id '<screenid>'}}.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Import a workflow that contains a screen that doesn't exist on the Jira instance
 # Step 2 Load the screens administration page {{<baseurl>/secure/admin/ViewFieldScreens.jspa}}

h3. Expected Results
A paginated view of the screens will show up, as well as the workflows that use the screens.

h3. Actual Results
When there is a workflow imported that contains a screen that doesn't exist, loading the Screen Administration page {{<baseurl>/secure/admin/ViewFieldScreens.jspa}} fails with the message below
 !image-2021-09-30-16-47-40-827.png|thumbnail! 
The corresponding HAR file shows that an HTTP 500 error occured.
Tracking the session to the atlassian-jira.log file shows the exception:
{code}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot find Screen with id '<screenid>'.
{code}

h3. Workaround

* For adding a new screen:
Access this URL directly to add a screen: <Jira base URL>/secure/admin/AddNewFieldScreen.jspa

* To solve the missing screen id:
The KBs below show steps on how to solve the missing screen id. However, when another new workflow that contains invalid screen ids is imported, the screen admin page issue will reappear.
[Screens are not showing Workflow Association and can not delete unused screens in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/screens-are-not-showing-workflow-association-and-can-not-delete-unused-screens-in-jira-1055951067.html]
[IllegalArgumentException when searching for issues with specific statuses, or when loading the Workflows page in Jira server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/illegalargumentexception-when-searching-for-issues-with-specific-statuses-or-when-loading-the-workflows-page-in-jira-server-295305313.html]
fields.summary: Loading Screen Admin page fails due to workflows with invalid screen fields

Looking for a UI/UX feature request to remove the component icon entirely (or add a configuration option to allow Jira admins to optionally remove the icon).

 !image-2021-09-29-15-02-16-071.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: UI/UX Remove Component Icon - Two Dimensional Filter Gadget

fields.description:
In a Jira cluster, only allow one node to reindex at a time.

Another option would be to allow more than one to reindex, but only after acknowledging a warning message.

The reason for this request is an incident where two nodes were reindexing at the same time. This caused Jira to be inaccessible until the first node's reindex completed. This caused unexpected downtime.
fields.summary: In a Jira Cluster Only Allow One Node to Reindex at a Time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user changes the Assignee in the resolution screen, but does not set a resolution, the assignee drop down field will display an incorrect short username of the previous assignee. When you select a resolution and click done, the assignee is not updated as expected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create new Jira instance
 # create new project
 # edit screens and make sure the resolve issue screen has *resolution*, and that the resolution field is mandatory. /secure/admin/ViewFieldScreens.jspa
 # in the view resolutions screen, *clear the defaults.* /secure/admin/ViewResolutions.jspa
 # edit the workflow and make sure your *transition to done* is set to use the *Resolution Screen*.
 # connect a user directory to Jira. I used Microsoft Active Directory
 # Create a new issue in a project using the workflow you configured.
 # Assign the issue to a random user.
 # Transition to Done, you will be shown the resolution screen.
 # Change the assigned user *and do not touch the resolution field*.
 # Press the done button, you will see the assigned user field now shows the short username and has reverted to the original option.
 # Select a resolution
 # Press done button, the issue is resolved but the change in assignee did not work.

h3. Expected Results
The assignee will be updated to reflect the changes made in the resolution screen.
h3. Actual Results
The assignee change reverts to the previous user, and the incorrect user name is shown. 

Example: Test User (TestU) would become TestU after clicking done. The problem is that the field also reverts to the previous assignee so the update to assignee is not completed  unless you select the username from the dropdown for a second time.

h3. Workaround
This is only possible if there is no default resolution set, so the easiest way to workaround this is to set a default resolution.
fields.summary: Click Done on resolution screen when no resolution set causes Assignee change to fail.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using a transition, if you change a cascading select (or a select/multi select) field that has a previously set value to the value (none) and save it, it not save the selection and append (not available) to the drop-down (select) field that was last used.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Cascading Select in the custom field configuration for a Project.
 # Mark it as Required (Administration --> Issues --> Field Configurations) 
 # Create a transition that uses a screen that has the Cascading Select.
 # Create an issue and select a parent and child issue. Save it.
 # In the Issue window, click on the Transition to edit the values.
 # Under Parent select option, change to (none).
 # Save the edit.
 # Note that the save doesn't get written yet.

h3. Expected Results

Not appending "(not available)" to one of the select options when having to confirm the required field, but it appears (by design) we'd still expect the message saying the field is required.  The confusion reported is that there's the second (duplicated from the previous selection) entry that has "(not available)" appended.
h3. Actual Results
 # Selecting (none) results in a message saying the field is required.
 # A duplicate option shows up with (not available) appended. (see attached screenshot)
 # You can save after this, but the issue will commit the last "known good" selection.
 # Note a message saying the Cascading Select is required (I think this is by design as per the previous updates to this functionality), but this confirms you are on the second "version" of the edit dialog, because you have to save again.
 # Note there is an additional option in the Parent field- it is the previously selected option with (not available) appended.
 # Save changes, which you can do without selecting anything else.
 # Note that the previously used value is defaulted due to code changes in 8.8.0 to prevent data loss (likely the result of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62455)

h3. Workaround

1. create a copy of <atlassian install directory>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport.properties for backup purposes.

2. change the line:
{code:java}
customfield.not.available.in.scheme={0} (not available)
{code}
to
{code:java}
customfield.not.available.in.scheme={0}
{code}
3. Restart Jira

 

(!) This will not prevent a second entry from showing in the Transition, but it will remove the (not available) tag from it and hopefully avoid end-user confusion. You will still have to save the transition twice.
fields.summary: Selecting none on a cascading select custom field during a transition results in a duplicate entry with (not available) appended.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Today, if a customer permission is set, it can be easily overwriten by a Project admin on project settings, this can be useful in a number of cases, but can also be undesired when it is important to apply the same rules in all projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Today it is possible to set a global customer permission following the steps below:
 # From the top right, select ** *Settings* (*) > *Products*.
 # Under *Jira Service Management*, select *Configuration*.
 # Under *Customer permissions*, select the desired permissions.

However there is no option to avoid the project manager from changing this from the project options on the 'customer permissions' session.
h3. Expected Results

To have an option that ensures the global customer permissions are not overwritten.
h3. Actual Results

There is no option to stop the Project admin fro changing customer permissions in a project level

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Let the Jira Admin set a global customer permissions and restrict Project Admins from changing it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary It appears that the developer documentation for Jira Server/Data center REST API starting with 8.19.0 has changed the formatting of the endpoints listed in documentation. Example: https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.19.0/#issue-getIssue now indicates the endpoint to get an issue is GET /rest/issue/\{issueIdOrKey\} This is a noted change since in 8.18 and all recent versions of the API have had an endpoint naming convention of /rest/api/2/issue/\{issueIdOrKey\} as explained in https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.18.0/#api/2/issue-getIssue h3. Steps to Reproduce # Follow 8.19 REST API documentation to attempt to either create a new issue or GET an existing issue h3. Expected Results We expect to get back a json payload of the issue created, such as {code:borderStyle=solid} {"id":"10025","key":"SCRUM-26","self":"http://localhost:8191/rest/api/2/issue/10025"} {code} or when retrieving an existing issue a json payload of that issue details. h3. Actual Results {code:borderStyle=solid} % curl -u admin:password \ --request GET \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ http://localhost:8191/rest/issue/SCRUM-1 Oops, you've found a dead link. - JIRA

Oops, you've found a dead link.

  • Go back to the previous page
  • Go to the Home Page
  • Atlassian Jira Project Management Software
  • About Jira
  • Report a problem

Atlassian
% {code} h3. Workaround Please follow the 8.18 REST API documentation until this can be resolved. https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.18.0/
fields.summary: Jira Server REST API documentation for 8.19.x has invalid endpoints

fields.description:
h4. Problem
Jira Software and JSM 8.17/4.17, 8.18/4.18,8.19/4.19 (possibly older versions, as well) ships with MsSQL JDBC Driver 9.2.1, but our [Supported Platforms for Jira documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0818/supported-platforms-1082266293.html] only lists 7.2.1 as supported. Release notes don't indicate when the switch in the shipped version was changed, either, unlike the change to JDBC version 7.

h4. Proposed Solution
List the shipped version of the driver as a supported version in our documentation.

h4. Why this is important
Consistency between practice and documentation allows for clearer communication and understanding for both support teams and customers.
fields.summary: Jira/JSM Ships with MsSQL JDBC Driver 9.2.1, but documentation only lists 7.2.1 as supported

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The instructions for CSV imports include examples of attachment address syntax, but do not include the syntax for authenticating with Jira to download the attachments.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Follow the instructions for importing here: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-csv-938847533.html]
 # Use the example syntax for http/https-based Jira URLs, and modify the csv according to the instructions
 # Perform the import

h3. Expected Results

Attachments will be downloaded
h3. Actual Results

Attachments are not downloaded.  Instead, html error files are downloaded for every attachment because the download requests are not authenticated.
h3. Workaround

We should update the import instructions to include the following syntax, which is included in this [Jira cloud KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/importing-attachments-into-jira-cloud-using-csv-external-system-importer-966669960.html]:
{code:java}
14/Feb/19 3:53 PM;admin;image.png;https://<JIRA-Server-Username>:<JIRA-Server-Password>@myjirasite.com/secure/attachment/10000/image.png {code}
This syntax is not just for importing into Jira Cloud, but for any import that pulls attachments from any Jira instance where those attachments are not publicly exposed.
fields.summary: Include syntax for credentials in csv attachment import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira does not have a limit for the number of issues that can be linked to a single issue.
This allows a single Jira issue to have unlimited issues linked.
This can lead to OutOfMemoryErrors and sequential Full GCs.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 5000+ issues in Jira
 # Link 500+ issues to a single issue;
 # Try to load the issue that contains 500+ Issue Links;

h3. Expected Results

Jira should load the Issue Links in batches to avoid memory exhaustion. 
h3. Actual Results

Jira will load all Issue Links in memory and cause several sequential Full GCs.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Limit the number of linked issues in a single Jira issue.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Permissions dialog does not returns the focus to the main window when it gets closed via the cancel button.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login as an admin user.
 # Go to *Administration panel* -> *Issues* -> *Permission Schemes*.
 # Click on the *Permissions* link for any of those e.g. default permission scheme.
 # Click *Edit at* any of the visible permissions.
 # Click *Cancel* at the appeared dialog.

h3. Expected Results

The focus should return to the background window when the dialog/modal is closed.
h3. Actual Results

The screen remains greyed, until a click is made or the escape button is pressed.
h3. Workaround

No workaround, just click at any place.
fields.summary: Focus is not returned to the main screen when the Permissions modal/dialog is cancelled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Description

A user cannot be mentioned (=this user can't be found in the user picker list when typing its username), under the following conditions:
- the username of the impacted user has a dot (full stop) character in it
- there are at least other 10 users which full name or username contains part of the username of the impacted user
- these 10 users are ranked before the impacted user in the alphabetic order

This issue occurs with various fields such as the comment field or the description field, and in any screen (view issue, edit issue and create issue screens).

h3. Steps to replicate

- Create 11 users using the full name and username listed below, and a dummy email address:
||Full Name||username||
|User1 Totoro|someone1.totoro|
|User2 Totoro|someone2.totoro|
|User3 Totoro|someone3.totoro|
|User4 Totoro|someone4.totoro|
|User5 Totoro|someone5.totoro|
|User6 Totoro|someone6.totoro|
|User7 Totoro|someone7.totoro|
|User8 Totoro|someone8.totoro|
|User9 Totoro|someone9.totoro|
|User10 Totoro|someone10.totoro|
|User11 Totoro|totoro.tu|
- Grant a Jira license to all these users
 !Step1.png|thumbnail! 
- Create a new project, and make sure that all these users have the *Browse Projects* permission in this project
- Create a new ticket in this project
- Try to add a new comment
- In the new comment, try to mention the user "totoro.tu" by typing @ and then "totoro.tu"


h3. Expected behavior

The user "totoro.tu" should be listed in the user picker list.
 !Step2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual behavior

No user is listed:
 !Step3.png|thumbnail! 

The same behavior is observed with the description field:
 !Step4.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

h4. Workaround 1

After you looked for "totoro.tu" and did not find any user, click outside the comment box, and then click back inside the command box. The user will be magically listed:
 !Step2.png|thumbnail! 

Note that if you refresh the page, the effect of the workaround will disappear, and the workaround will need to be executed again for the user to be listed.

h4. Workaround 2

Use the following syntax to mention the impacted user, instead of searching for it:
{code}
[~totoro.tu]
{code}

h4. Workaround 3

Instead of search for "totoro.tu", search for "tu". If there are no other users that match "tu" and which are listed before "totoro.tu" in the alphabetic order, then the user "totoro.tu" will be found.

h3. Note

A screen recording showing the behavior and the 1st workaround has been attached to this bug ticket:
 [^Screen Recording 2021-09-24 at 10.07.37.mov]
fields.summary: Under some conditions, some specific users can't be mentioned in Jira issues

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The error "Request header is too large" occurs immediately after upgrading Jira from 8.13.2 to 8.17.1 There were no changes in data or configuration. Editing a workflow was not possible and trigger the error . It seems that the new version require more header space than the previous version.

The related URL
{noformat}
https://base-url/secure/project/SelectProjectWorkflowSchemeStep3.jspa?...)
 {noformat}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Not easy to reproduce, depend on Instance data and configuration
h3. Expected Results

The new Jira version should work as the previous version
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the log file:
{noformat}
13-Sep-2021 05:33:48.569 INFO [https-jsse-nio-8443-exec-47] org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.service Error parsing HTTP request header
 Note: further occurrences of HTTP request parsing errors will be logged at DEBUG level.
	java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Request header is too large
		at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11InputBuffer.parseHeaders(Http11InputBuffer.java:617)
		at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.service(Http11Processor.java:525)
...
{noformat}
 - The related URL
{noformat}
https://base-url/secure/project/SelectProjectWorkflowSchemeStep3.jspa?...)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

1- On Jira server, increase the Tomcat header size to 16834 in your "server.xml" file
{code:java}
maxHttpHeaderSize="16834"
{code}
This change requires a node restart and should be applied to all nodes ( you can restart the nodes in round robin to avoid downtime}

2- If you are using Proxy/Reverse Proxy, you will need to adjust the maxHttpHeaderSize on it as well.

Apache: [http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/core.html#limitrequestline]
 Nginx: [http://nginx.org/en/docs/http/ngx_http_core_module.html#large_client_header_buffers]

(!) As best practices we suggest  to first test those changes  in a test/staging environment prior to rolling out any changes to a production environment.
fields.summary: Increasing the Tomcat parameter "maxHttpHeaderSize" from the default value 8192 to 16834 for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the Upgrade Checklist article, the first row of the table, "Research & decision" contains a link under the column "Notes" to the Upgrade Matrix.  The URL of the link points to the Upgrade Checklist, the same page it is on, as opposed to the Upgrade Matrix. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/upgrade-checklist-966063320.html]
 # Click the Upgrade matrix link at the top of the table

h3. Expected Results

Clicking the Upgrade Matrix should take you to [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/upgrade-matrix-966063322.html]
h3. Actual Results

Clicking the Upgrade Matrix currently does nothing; it just reloads the same page.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Editing a table to apply/change colors mess up the table format
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a table with 5 rows and columns or use the same data given below:
{quote}
|*Rating*|*How many vehicles*|*How many customers*|*Risk (Hazardous event) probability*|*Risk (Harm) Impact*|*Regional extension*|
|1|<100| |1|1|Single use case in one specific road|
|2|100<x<1,000| |{color:#172b4d}2{color}|{color:#de350b}2{color}|Limited to 1 nation|
|3|1000<x<100,000|1|{color:#172b4d}3{color}| |Limited to 1 region (EU, China, US…)|
|4|100,000<x<1,000,000|2|{color:#172b4d}4{color}|{color:#172b4d}4{color}|Limited to 2 regions|
|5|1,000,000<x|>2|{color:#172b4d}5{color}|{color:#172b4d}5{color}|Global|
{quote}
 # -Change the color twice or thrice for two or more values and save it.- - I couldn't replicate it, but I've noticed that the above table has some colors already applied to some cells - it seems that changing color of cell that has already some color set causes double color tags to be appended.
 # select all data in some cell that has no color set yet
 # change color of selected cell to red
 # save description
 # open edit again in visual mode and select all data from updated cell (should have red colour)
 # change color to green - there should be no update of the color visible in the visual mode, if you switch to text mode you will see double color tags
 # This will change the format of the table as the color tag is added twice. This can be observed from the text editor.

h3. Expected Results

While changing the color remove the older color tag and keep just the selected color.
h3. Actual Results

Table format changes and makes it unreadable.
h3. Workaround

Use "clear format" from the "more" menu prior to setting up colour
Upgrade to the latest version of Jira
The issue does not appear on 8.18.x, 8.19.x
fields.summary: Table data in Jira Issue description is messed up when color is applied repeatedly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Following this KB: [Custom Field Width Less than Available Options Length|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/custom-field-width-less-than-available-options-length-240912344.html], the user will be able to increase the width. However, if you have a select field option that is bigger(image 1) below), even with the javacript set to auto, the width takes off the rest of the select field option.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to _Administrator > Custom Fields_
 # Click on the select list custom field whose width or size you want to update
 # Click the Edit button next to it.
 # Update the *Description* section as below
{code:java}
<script type="text/javascript">

var j = document.getElementsByName('customfield_14295');

if(j.length > 0)

j[0].setAttribute("style","width: auto");

j[0].setAttribute("size", "8");

</script>{code}

 # After that, create an option that is bigger (image 1)
 # While creating or editing the issue, this option is not correctly shown.

h3. Expected Results

Since the width is set as auto on the javascript, it should be able to see all the select list options.
h3. Actual Results

It is showing just one part of the select list option.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom field width is not rendering correctly

fields.description:

Docs:
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/integrating-with-development-tools-using-dvcs-1047552689.html]
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/linking-gitlab-accounts-1027142272.html]

 

The webhook is only created automatically during the account linking process. If permissions are swapped after that is already established, webhooks will not be created then (unless done so manually afterwards)

 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/delays-for-commits-to-display-in-development-panel-in-jira-server-779160823.html] needs to be updated to include Gitlab documentation.

fields.description:
As an admin of Jira, I would like to have documentation on what happens when a repository is deleted from the DVCS page.

The 'delete' button is a small x to the right of each repository, but it's only there when you hover.

This functionality and button are not mentioned on this page:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/integrating-with-development-tools-using-dvcs-1047552689.html]

Here are the results of my testing:
 * When an individual repository is deleted from Jira:
 ** Its data will remain in the database
 ** It will no longer sync and information about that repository will be removed silently from all Issues' development panels.
 * When a previously deleted individual repository is added back to Jira:
 ** It will begin syncing immediately
 ** Any information about this repository relevant to an Issue's development panel will be added back to that panel.
fields.summary: DVCS docs - Delete Repository
